definition[0]: to gradually reduce the work of a business or organization so that it can be closed down completely
definition[1]: to rest and relax after a lot of hard work or excitement
example[0]: I find it difficult to wind down after a day at work.
definition[2]: to make something, especially a car window, move down by turning a handle or pressing a button
example[1]: The company has been winding down its business for 10 months because it was operating unprofitably.
